response:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: Process p = Runtime.getRuntime().exec("netsh.exe wlan show profiles name=superonline key=clear");
BufferedReader bf = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(p.getInputStream()));
while (bf.readLine() != null)
System.out.println(bf.readLine());
<<<explanation>>>: You can't do this from a standard user. You need to run as an administrator.
Question: How to get the IP address of the computer from which the request is made:I want to get the IP address of the computer from which the request is made. I have tried the following code:

String ip = request.getRemoteAddr();

But it is not working.

Please using this api: InputStream.read.
Answer:<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: String ip = request.getRemoteAddr();
<<<explanation>>>: You can't get the IP address of the computer from which the request is made. You can get the IP address of the server that is hosting the web page.
